title: Haldir Frenzies
excerpt: When the Haldir were cut off from the Zedonia, something clicked inside them. They took to the city where they got in a frenzy, thus earning this conflict its name.
content:
The cries of a hungry people lead to the bloodbath that people of @[Matona](settlement:ed81f438-3853-4cff-85f2-5b7e233024b1) know today as the Haldir Frenzies. The people of @[The Dwarven Mining Enterprise](organization:7da5d532-16b7-402d-bafe-8d582ca2a777) with the help of the @[Kingdom of Illtresi](organization:d5cb649e-a3cd-4a2d-b065-5512783135ef) poured in their best efforts to come to a peaceful solution with the dwarves. However, the @[Haldir](ethnicity:cd79c677-c98e-4580-9153-d36718c557b6), already driven mad by the lack of @[Zedonias](material:6a929cbe-43da-49d2-8bc7-cded09522f24), took their frenzy to the streets of the town forcing the hands of all the parties involved.

[quote]These.. decaying dwarfs look scary. They want the Zedonias all to themselves, but we cannot allow for that to happen. We offered them other goods and aid, but it seems like they are deaf to all our proposals. It is as if there is more it than they are willing to let on. Why are they so reliant on the Zedonias? Either way, I hope we can keep the city safe...|Snippet from the first report on the Haldir Frenzies[/quote]

[h2]Missing Investigators[/h2]
During the excavation of @[Zedonias](material:6a929cbe-43da-49d2-8bc7-cded09522f24), a few @[miners](profession:b8855c87-1d5a-4849-bfbe-a8695354ac02) from the Mining Enterprise noticed that the number of calcified eggs in the lair decreased at a faster rate than they were digging up, so they informed the company. In response, a small team of investigators set out to the lair and deeper into the mountains to find the cause of the disappearance. After ten days, none of them had returned.

Worried about their employees, @[The Dwarven Mining Enterprise](organization:7da5d532-16b7-402d-bafe-8d582ca2a777) sent another group of investigators into the mountains, this time accompanied by a squat from the @[Limani Supplier Security Services](formation:68971805-a026-41bd-9154-6e6dd9ddcb71) for their protection. What they found was not a pleasant sight..

[quote]We found them... I've taken their personal belonging and put them together for each investigator, so we can bring it back to the family. There is... let's just say there's not much left of the bodies. Whoever did this can consider themselves monsters, who can do something like that to a fellow dwarf?!|Snippet from the Diary of Thannik, one of the security guards from the Limani Supplier Security Services[/quote]

The second group got safely back with their report of what they found in the mountains, including their suspicions of the people responsible. With this knowledge in mind, especially what they had done to the first group of investigators, the company called in a close ally of the city: the @[Kingdom of Illtresi](organization:d5cb649e-a3cd-4a2d-b065-5512783135ef).

[quote]Sortly after we had begun our operation, the Haldir must have noticed that their supply of Zedonias reduced rapidly. We suspect that they likely have sent scouts to have a look, just like we sent our investigators, and the two groups have met somewhere in the middle.|Snippet from Thanniks report[/quote]

@[Greze Urngorr](location:ff1fbd3f-81e5-49c5-a8d5-0ab957a265ed)[br]

[p][b]Involved Parties[/b][/center]
[container:row][container:col-md-6 text-center]@[Haldir](ethnicity:cd79c677-c98e-4580-9153-d36718c557b6)[/container][container:col-md-6 text-center]Instigator[/container][/container]
[container:row][container:col-md-6 text-center]@[The Dwarven Mining Enterprise](organization:7da5d532-16b7-402d-bafe-8d582ca2a777)[/container][container:col-md-6 text-center]Initial Casualties[/container][/container]
[container:row][container:col-md-6 text-center]@[Kingdom of Illtresi](organization:d5cb649e-a3cd-4a2d-b065-5512783135ef)[/container][container:col-md-6 text-center]Allies[/container][/container]
[container:row][container:col-md-6 text-center]@[People of Matona](settlement:ed81f438-3853-4cff-85f2-5b7e233024b1)[/container][container:col-md-6 text-center]Victims[/container][/container][/p]
[p][center][b]Root Cause[/b][br]
Ownership of the @[Zedonias](material:6a929cbe-43da-49d2-8bc7-cded09522f24) in @[Greze Urngorr](location:ff1fbd3f-81e5-49c5-a8d5-0ab957a265ed)[/center][/p]
[p][center][b]Cause for Violence[/b][br]
Haldir became more aggressive during negotiations after having killed a group of investigators from the mining enterprise.[/center][/p]
sidebarcontentbottom:
[anchor|negotiations]

[aloud]
[h3]Negotiations[/h3]
Spokespeople from the mining enterprise and the kingdom have tried to negotiate with the Haldir to find a more peaceful solution. However, the Haldir dwarves were adamant and didn't want to share the @[Zedonia](material:6a929cbe-43da-49d2-8bc7-cded09522f24) as a resource. Every proposal was met with resistance and refusal which frustrated the spokespeople enormously. Furthermore, the Haldir became increasingly more aggressive with every potential solution we present.

After 30 days, they gave up. It was simply impossible to negotiate with these people. The @[Kingdom of Illtresi](organization:d5cb649e-a3cd-4a2d-b065-5512783135ef) sent troops to @[Matona](settlement:ed81f438-3853-4cff-85f2-5b7e233024b1) to help secure the lair with Zedonias and prevent the @[Haldir](ethnicity:cd79c677-c98e-4580-9153-d36718c557b6) from getting their hands on more of it, effectively cutting them off fully. They hoped that using a power move, they could get the Haldir to cooperate and accept one of the earlier proposals.[/aloud]
fullfooter:
[h2]Frenzy Trashing[/h2]
After the [url:#negotiations]negotiations[/url] fell apart and the Kingdom had stationed their army, the @[Haldir](ethnicity:cd79c677-c98e-4580-9153-d36718c557b6) had no longer access to the @[Zedonias](material:6a929cbe-43da-49d2-8bc7-cded09522f24). As the days passed, they grew increasingly more aggressive. Their faces turned darker, eyes saw literally red, and their lengthened finger nails became pointy like claws. Slowly, the Haldir wandered off in the direction where the Zedonias were being taken, almost as if they could smell the objects through the caverns. Eventually, the dwarves dodder outside where they laid eyes on @[Matona](settlement:ed81f438-3853-4cff-85f2-5b7e233024b1) for the first time. Steadfast, they continued to walk towards the big town, but no one could explain why.

The people of Matona had no idea what was happening. A strange group of straggled dwarfs poured into the streets, aimlessly looking around. Out of nowhere, one of the members started thrashing. A form of magic seeped out of its fingertips, setting houses ablaze. Soon, more Haldir entered the same frenzied state of mind until all of them were turned. They attacked any person in sight, anything that moved, anything that looked shiny.

The city militia was taken by surprise during the first wave of attacks. They scrambled together as fast as they could to drive back the frenzied Haldir, while also sending out two messengers. The first going to the Kingdom army in the mines and the second going to the establishment of the @[The Dwarven Mining Enterprise](organization:7da5d532-16b7-402d-bafe-8d582ca2a777) informing them of the outbreak and to ask for reinforcements. A few of security men from the @[Limani Supplier Security Services](formation:68971805-a026-41bd-9154-6e6dd9ddcb71) who were still in town, gave the militia an extra helping hand until the army arrived.

Countless villagers died during this first wave as the city militia was pulling itself together. However, with the help of the army and the security service men, they quickly drove the Haldir back to the mountains. With every subsequent wave, the number of Haldir dwindled slowly but surely until they had rid the mines of all the decayed dwarfs.
scrapbook:
- The @[Haldir](ethnicity:cd79c677-c98e-4580-9153-d36718c557b6) noticed their supply of @[Zedonias](material:6a929cbe-43da-49d2-8bc7-cded09522f24) disappearing
  - At first, they started starving their weakest members to give themselves time to investigate
  - Mining company in @[Matona](settlement:ed81f438-3853-4cff-85f2-5b7e233024b1) noticed the same thing and send investigators to the lairs. They were killed by the Haldir scouts
  - The company sent a second group with protection from the @[Limani Supplier Security Services](formation:68971805-a026-41bd-9154-6e6dd9ddcb71) after the lifeless bodies of the first group of investigators was found

When the two groups came face to face, the people from Matona tried to make concessions with the Haldir. They asked the Haldir not to kill their people and to work towards a peaceful solution, but to no avail.
  -> Haldir kept killing innocent miners. So, the @[Kingdom of Illtresi](organization:d5cb649e-a3cd-4a2d-b065-5512783135ef) stepped in and assisted the mining company by brining an army to protect the Zedonias and the miners.

Without the Zedonias, all the Haldir turned into husks and started venturing out of the mountains and into the city. With crystals made from the Zedonias everywhere, they quickly turned into a frenzy. This ultimately gave name to the event: the Haldir Frenzies.

Haldir Frenzies
- Describe physical transformation by the lack of Zedonias
- They still couldn't get to the Zedonias, so they wandered off in the direction where they (Zedonias) are taken
- They wander into the city, which is littered with all kinds of draconic stuff, which sets off the frenzies
- Countless villages died during the first wave, as the local militia scrambled together. They quickly sent a messenger to the mines and to the dwarves mining enterprise establishment to inform them about the outbreak and to ask for reinforcements. A few people from the Limani Sec Services who were still in the city helped out as well.
